meta.dc:title: 116 S 1014 ES: To establish the Route 66 Centennial Commission, and for other purposes.
meta.dc:creator: United States Senate
meta.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

preface.currentChamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

longTitle.officialTitle: To establish the Route 66 Centennial Commission, and for other purposes.

main.enactingFormula: Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

section.heading: SHORT TITLE.
section.content: This Act may be cited as the “Route 66 Centennial Commission Act”.

paragraph.content: Route 66 was the first all-weather highway in the United States connecting the Midwest to California, and has played a major role in the history of the United States;

Route 66 has become a symbol of the heritage of travel and the legacy of seeking a better life shared by the people of the United States, and has been enshrined in the popular culture of the United States; and

the year 2026 will be the centennial anniversary of Route 66, and a commission should be established to study and recommend in a report to Congress activities that are fitting and proper to celebrate that anniversary in a manner that appropriately honors the Mother Road of the United States.

section.heading: ESTABLISHMENT.
section.content: There is established a commission to be known as the “Route 66 Centennial Commission” (referred to in this Act as the “Commission”).

paragraph.chapeau: study activities that may be carried out by the Federal Government to determine whether the activities are fitting and proper to honor Route 66 on the occasion of the centennial anniversary of Route 66, including activities such as—

subparagraph.content: the issuance of commemorative coins, medals, certificates of recognition, and postage stamps;
ceremonies and celebrations commemorating specific events; and
the production, publication, and distribution of books, pamphlets, films, electronic publications, and other educational materials; and
the activities that the Commission considers most fitting and proper to honor Route 66 on the occasion described in paragraph (1); and
1 or more entities in the Federal Government that the Commission considers most appropriate to carry out those activities.

subsection.heading: Number and Appointment.—
subsection.chapeau: The Commission shall be composed of 15 members appointed as follows:

paragraph.content: 3 members, each of whom shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Secretary of Transportation.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Illinois.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Missouri.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Kansas.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Oklahoma.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Texas.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of New Mexico.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of Arizona.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Governor of California.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Speaker of the House of Representatives.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Minority Leader of the House of Representatives.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Majority Leader of the Senate.
1 member, who shall be an eligible individual described in subsection (b), appointed by the President based on the recommendation of the Minority Leader of the Senate.

subsection.heading: Eligible Individual.—
subsection.chapeau: An eligible individual referred to in subsection (a) is an individual with—

paragraph.content: a demonstrated dedication to educating others about the importance of historical figures and events; and
substantial knowledge and appreciation of Route 66.

subsection.heading: Time of Appointment.—
subsection.content: Each initial appointment of a member of the Commission shall be made before the expiration of the 120-day period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act.

subsection.heading: Terms.—
subsection.content: Each member shall be appointed for the life of the Commission.

subsection.heading: Vacancies.—
subsection.content: A vacancy in the Commission shall not affect the powers of the Commission but shall be filled in the manner in which the original appointment was made.

subsection.heading: Basic Pay.—
subsection.content: Members shall serve on the Commission without pay.

subsection.heading: Travel Expenses.—
subsection.content: Each member shall receive travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, in accordance with sections 5702 and 5703 of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.heading: Quorum.—
subsection.content: 7 members of the Commission shall constitute a quorum, but a lesser number may hold hearings.

subsection.heading: Chair and Vice Chair.—
subsection.content: The Commission shall select a Chair and Vice Chair from among the members of the Commission.

subsection.heading: Meetings.—
subsection.content: The Commission shall meet at the call of the Chair.

subsection.heading: Director.—
subsection.content: The Commission may appoint and fix the pay of a Director and such additional personnel as the Commission considers to be appropriate.

subsection.heading: Applicability of Certain Civil Service Laws.—

paragraph.heading: Director.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Director of the Commission shall—

subparagraph.content: be appointed without regard to the provisions of title 5, United States Code, governing appointments in the competitive service; and

be paid without regard to the provisions of chapter 51 and subchapter III of chapter 53 of title 5, United States Code, relating to classification and General Schedule pay rates, except that the rate of pay for the Director may not exceed the rate payable for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of that title.

paragraph.heading: Staff.—
paragraph.chapeau: The staff of the Commission shall—

subparagraph.content: be appointed without regard to the provisions of title 5, United States Code, governing appointments in the competitive service; and
be paid without regard to the provisions of chapter 51 and subchapter III of chapter 53 of title 5, United States Code, relating to classification and General Schedule pay rates.

paragraph.content: no Federal funds may be expended to compensate a Director or staff member of the Commission under this section; and
any compensation paid to a Director or any staff of the Commission appointed under this section shall be derived solely from donated funds.

subsection.heading: Hearings and Sessions.—
subsection.content: The Commission may hold such hearings, sit and act at such times and places, take such testimony, and receive such evidence as the Commission considers to be appropriate to carry out this Act.

subsection.heading: Powers of Members and Agents.—
subsection.content: Any member or agent of the Commission may, if authorized by the Commission, take any action that the Commission is authorized to take under this Act.

subsection.heading: Mails.—
subsection.content: The Commission may use the United States mails in the same manner and under the same conditions as other Federal departments and agencies.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: On the request of the Commission, the Administrator of General Services shall provide to the Commission, on a reimbursable basis, the administrative support services necessary for the Commission to carry out this Act.

clause.heading: In general.—
clause.content: At the request of the Commission, the head of any Federal agency or department may detail to the Commission, on a reimbursable or nonreimbursable basis, any employee of the agency or department.

clause.heading: Civil service status.—
clause.content: The detail of an employee under clause (i) shall be without interruption or loss of civil service status or privilege.

clause.heading: No additional compensation.—
clause.content: A Federal employee who is detailed to the Commission under this subparagraph may not receive any additional pay, allowances, benefits, or other compensation by reason of the detail of the employee to the Commission or any services performed by the employee for the Commission.
accept the services of personnel detailed from a State; and
reimburse the State for the services of the detailed personnel.

subsection.heading: Volunteer and Uncompensated Services.—
subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 1342 of title 31, United States Code, the Commission may accept and use such voluntary and uncompensated services as the Commission determines to be necessary.

subsection.heading: Gifts.—
subsection.content: The Commission may accept, use, and dispose of gifts, grants, bequests, or devises of money, services, or property from any public or private source for the purpose of covering the costs incurred by the Commission in carrying out this Act.

subsection.heading: Interim Reports.—
subsection.content: The Commission may submit to Congress such interim reports as the Commission considers to be appropriate.

subsection.heading: Final Report.—
subsection.chapeau: Not later than 2 years after the date on which all members of the Commission are appointed, the Commission shall submit to Congress a final report containing—

paragraph.content: a detailed statement of the findings and conclusions of the Commission;
the recommendations of the Commission; and
any other information that the Commission considers to be appropriate.

section.heading: TERMINATION.
section.content: The Commission shall terminate on December 31, 2026.

subsection.heading: In General.—
subsection.content: All expenditures of the Commission, including any reimbursement required under this Act, shall be made solely from donated funds.

subsection.heading: No Additional Funds Authorized.—
subsection.content: No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act.

longTitle.officialTitle: To establish the Route 66 Centennial Commission, and for other purposes.
